tit.cmt: The rules of local assembly (Fuken-kai) http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110004533725

sen.j: 府県会規則（ふけんかいきそく）とは、明治時代に制定された、日本の府県に府県会を置くことをはじめて定めた規則のこと。
sen.e: Established in Meiji era, the Fuken-kai rule, which sets rules of local assembly, was the first rules in Japan which specified placing Fuken-kai in prefectures in Japan.
Established in the Meiji era, the Fuken-kai rules, which set the rules of local assemblies, were the first rules in Japan which specified the establishment of Fuken-kai in prefectures in Japan.
Established in the Meiji era, the Fuken-kai rules, which set the rules of local assemblies, were the first rules in Japan which specified the establishment of Fuken-kai in prefectures in Japan.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History
The year 1878
The year 1878
The year 1878

sen.j: いわゆる地方三新法の一つとして、1878年7月22日に太政官布告第18号により発布された。
sen.e: It was promulgated in the edict of DajokanNo.18 (Grand Council of State) on July22, 1878, as one of the so-called three new bills related to the local government system.
It was promulgated in the edict of DajokanNo.18 (Grand Council of State) on July 22, 1878, as one of the so-called three new bills related to the local government system.
It was promulgated in the edict of DajokanNo.18 (Grand Council of State) on July 22, 1878, as one of the so-called three new bills related to the local government system.

sen.j: 府県会規則の制定以前には、一部の府知事、県令が顧問的な会議（地方民会）を招集した例はあっても、法制度上の地方議会は存在しなかった。
sen.e: Before the establishment of the Fuken-kai rule, though there were examples of some prefectural governors calling for advisory meetings (local assembly), local assembly did not exist under as a legal system.

Before the establishment of the Fuken-kai rules, though there were examples in which some prefectural governors callied for advisory meetings (local assemblies), the local assembly did not exist as a legal system.
sen.cmt: 単数形を複数形にしました。
sen.e: Before the establishment of the Fuken-kai rules, though there were examples in which some prefectural governors callied for advisory meetings (local assemblies), the local assembly did not exist as a legal system.

sen.j: 府県会規則は、地方制度ではあるが近代日本の議会の出発点であり、同じく選挙制度の出発点でもある。
sen.e: The Fuken-kai rule is a local system but it is the starting point for modern Japan's assembly as well as the election system.
The Fuken-kai rules are a local system, but it is the starting point for the modern Japan's assembly as well as the election system.
The Fuken-kai rules are a local system, but it is the starting point for the modern Japan's assembly as well as the election system.

sen.j: なお、府県会規則は、北海道と沖縄県には適用されなかった。
sen.e: Fuken-kai rules did not apply to Hokkaido or Okinawa prefecture.
Fuken-kai rules did not apply to Hokkaido or Okinawa prefecture.
Fuken-kai rules did not apply to Hokkaido or Okinawa prefecture.
The year 1890.
The year 1890.
The year 1890.

sen.j: 府県制施行によって廃止された。
sen.e: It was abolished with the enforcement of Fuken (prefectures) system.
It was abolished with the enforcement of the Fuken (prefectures) system.
It was abolished with the enforcement of the Fuken (prefectures) system.

sen.j: 歴史的意義
sen.e: Historical significance
Historical significance
Historical significance

sen.j: 府県会規則における府県会の権限は、小さく弱いものと評価されている。
sen.e: The authority of Fuken-kai under the Fuken-kai rule is acclaimed to be small and weak.
The authority of the Fuken-kai under the Fuken-kai rules is acclaimed to be small and weak.
The authority of the Fuken-kai under the Fuken-kai rules is acclaimed to be small and weak.

sen.j: 府県会は府知事・県令に議案提出権を握られ、その府県内の事項を自分から取り上げることができなかった。
sen.e: Fuken-kai could not raise issues within the prefecture as prefectural governors held the right to submit the bill.
Fuken-kai could not raise issues within the prefectures as prefectural governors held the right to submit bills.
Fuken-kai could not raise issues within the prefectures as prefectural governors held the right to submit bills.

sen.j: 決議を執行するに際して、あらゆる面で府知事・県令の許可・認可が必要であった。
sen.e: When enforcing the resolution, permission and approval from the prefectural governor were needed from all aspects.
When enforcing resolutions, permission and approval from the prefectural governor were needed from all aspects.
When enforcing resolutions, permission and approval from the prefectural governor were needed from all aspects.

sen.j: さらに、府知事・県令は府県会と衝突するとしばしばこれを解散した。
sen.e: In addition, prefectural governors dismissed it when conflicting with Fuken-kai.
In addition, when prefectural governors conflicted with Fuken-ka, they dismissed it.
In addition, when prefectural governors conflicted with Fuken-ka, they dismissed it.

sen.j: 選挙制度の面でも、限界がめだつ。
sen.e: Limitations stand out also from the perspective of the election system.
Limitations also stand out from the perspective of the election system.
Limitations also stand out from the perspective of the election system.

sen.j: 選挙権と被選挙権に性別と納税資格の制限を課した。
sen.e: Voting right and eligiblility to run for election were limited by gender and tax payment qualification.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Voting right and eligiblility to run for election were limited by gender and tax payment qualification.
Voting right and eligiblility to run for election were limited by gender and tax payment qualification.

sen.j: 条文にはないが投票は記名式であった。
sen.e: Although not specified in the articles, votes were signed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Although not specified in the articles, votes were signed.
Although not specified in the articles, votes were signed.

sen.j: しかしながら、それ以前と比べるならば、選挙による地方議会が発足したことには意義がある。
sen.e: However, when compared with the past, it is significant that a local assembly was launched by election.
However, when compared with the past, it is significant that a local assembly was launched by election.
However, when compared with the past, it is significant that a local assembly was launched by election.

sen.j: 府県会は自由民権運動の舞台の一つとなった。
sen.e: Fuken-kai became the stage for Jiyu Minken Undo. (Movement for Liberty and People's Right)
Fuken-kai became a stage for Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right).
Fuken-kai became a stage for Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right).

sen.j: 条文の内容
sen.e: Contents of the articles.
Contents of the articles.
Contents of the articles.

sen.j: 全部で14条によりなる。
sen.e: It consists of 14 articles.
It consists of 14 articles.
It consists of 14 articles.

sen.j: （引用は現代語訳）
sen.e: (Citation is in modern language)
(Citation is a translation in modern language.)
(Citation is a translation in modern language.)

sen.j: 目的
sen.e: Purpose
Purpose
Purpose

sen.j: 第一条で、「府県会は地方税を以て支弁すべき経費の予算及びその徴収方法を議定する」と府県会の目的を定めた。
sen.e: Article 1 specified the aim of Fuken-kai which is "to set the expense budget needed, based on local taxes, as well as the method for its collection."
Article 1 specified that the purpose of Fuken-kai was "to set the expense budget needed, based on local taxes, as well as the method for its collection."
Article 1 specified that the purpose of Fuken-kai was "to set the expense budget needed, based on local taxes, as well as the method for its collection."

sen.j: 府県会とは、府の府会、県の県会を合わせた呼び名である。
sen.e: Fuken-kai is the name which combines prefectural assemblies. (both "fu" and "ken")
Fuken-kai is the name which combines prefectural assemblies. (both "fu" and "ken")
Fuken-kai is the name which combines prefectural assemblies (both "fu" and "ken").
sen.cmt: ピリオドを最後に移動しました。

sen.j: 選挙権・被選挙権
sen.e: Right to vote and eligibility to run for election
Right to vote and eligibility to run for election
Right to vote and eligibility to run for election

sen.j: 府県会の議員は公選で、郡区ごとに五人以下が選ばれた（第10条）。
sen.e: Councilors of less than five people were selected by public election. (Article 10)
Five or less councilors were selected by public election (Article 10).
Five or less councilors were selected by public election (Article 10).

sen.j: 議員資格は満25歳以上の男子でその府県に本籍を定め、満三年以上居住し、地租10円以上を納める者である（第13条）。
sen.e: Qualifications to become a councilor were men having reached his 25th birthday with a registered address in that prefecture, who have lived there for over three years, and who paid over 10 yen of taxes on land. (Article 13)

Qualifications to become a councilor were males who had reached his 25th birthday, who had a registered address in that prefecture, who have lived there for over three years, and who paid a land tax of over 10 yen (Article 13).

Qualifications to become a councilor were males who had reached his 25th birthday, who had a registered address in that prefecture, who have lived there for over three years, and who paid a land tax of over 10 yen (Article 13).

sen.j: 選挙資格は、満20歳以上の男子で、その郡区内に本籍を定め、地租5円以上を納める者である（第14条）。
sen.e: Qualifications to vote was men having reached his 20th birthday with a registered address in that county/ward, who paid over 5 yen of taxes on land. (Article 14)
Qualifications to vote were males who had reached his 20th birthday, who had a registered address in that county/ward, and who paid a land tax of over 5 yen (Article 14).
Qualifications to vote were males who had reached his 20th birthday, who had a registered address in that county/ward, and who paid a land tax of over 5 yen (Article 14).

sen.j: 「風癲白痴の者」、「懲役一年以上実決の刑に処せられた者」、身代限（破産）の処分を受け負債の弁償を終えていないもの、官吏および教員は、選挙と被選挙の資格を持たなかった（第13条）。
sen.e: "Those who do not have fixed jobs and are foolish," those who have been sentenced to more than 1 year in prison with an actual jail sentence," those who have been declared bankrupt and have not finished paying for the debt were not eligible to vote nor have the eligibility to run for election.

"Those who are insane or idiotic," those who have been sentenced to more than 1 year in prison," those who have been declared bankrupt and have not finished paying for debts were not eligible to vote nor run for election.

"Those who are insane or idiotic," those who have been sentenced to more than 1 year in prison," those who have been declared bankrupt and have not finished paying for debts were not eligible to vote nor run for election.

sen.j: なお、議員の不逮捕特権はない。
sen.e: Councilors were not privileged to be immune from arrest.
Councilors were not privileged to be immune from arrest.
Councilors were not privileged to be immune from arrest.

sen.j: 会期等
sen.e: Terms etc.,
Terms etc.,
Terms etc.,

sen.j: 府県会の会期としては、年一回の通常会と、臨時に開く臨時会とがあった（第2条）。
sen.e: As for the term of Fuken-kai, there was an annual ordinary session and an extraordinary session that was held on a temporary basis.
As for the term of Fuken-kai, there was an annual ordinary session and an extraordinary session that was held on a temporary basis.
As for the term of Fuken-kai, there was an annual ordinary session and an extraordinary session that was held on a temporary basis.

sen.j: 会の議事細則は府県会自身が定めて府知事・県令が許可し（第9条）、議長と副議長は府県会の議員から公選して府知事・県令が認可する。
sen.e: Fuken-kai's detailed regulations for proceedings were set by Fuken-kai itself which was approved by the prefectural governor (Article 9) and the councilor and sub-councilor were to be elected by public election from the prefectural councilors who are approved by the prefectural governors.

Fuken-kai's detailed regulations for proceedings were set by Fuken-kai itself and were approved by the prefectural governor (Article 9), and the chairman and vice-chairman were to be elected by public election from among prefectural councilors and were approved by the prefectural governors.

Fuken-kai's detailed regulations for proceedings were set by Fuken-kai itself and were approved by the prefectural governor (Article 9), and the chairman and vice-chairman were to be elected by public election from among prefectural councilors and were approved by the prefectural governors.

sen.j: 議題
sen.e: Agenda
Agenda
Agenda

sen.j: 議題には、決算報告の受領（第6条）、予算、地方税徴収（第1条）の他に、地方税によって行なう事柄が定められた（第5条）。
sen.e: The agenda specified receipt of financial results (Article 6), budget, local taxes collection (Article 1) as well as issues to be handled with the local taxes (Article 5).
The agenda specified receipt of financial results (Article 6), budget, local taxes collection (Article 1) as well as issues to be handled with the local taxes (Article 5).
The agenda specified receipt of financial results (Article 6), budget, local taxes collection (Article 1) as well as issues to be handled with the local taxes (Article 5).

sen.j: 府知事・県令は地方税事項については府県会の議決に従うものとされたが、認可すべきでないと考えた場合には内務卿に報告し指揮を請うた。
sen.e: Prefectural governors were to follow the decisions by Fuken-kai regarding issues on local taxes but when they thought those decisions cannot be approved, they reported so to the minister of interior and asked for supervision.

Prefectural governors were to follow the decisions made by Fuken-kai regarding issues on local taxes, but if they thought they should not approve the decisions, they reported it to the minister of interior and asked for supervision.

Prefectural governors were to follow the decisions made by Fuken-kai regarding issues on local taxes, but if they thought they should not approve the decisions, they reported it to the minister of interior and asked for supervision.

sen.j: 府県会は他に、府県内の施策について府知事・県令が意見を問うた事柄についても議する（第8条）。
sen.e: In addition, Fuken-kai was to discuss issues which prefectural governors asked for opinions such as on measures taken in the prefecture. (Article 8)
In addition, Fuken-kai discussed issues which prefectural governors asked for opinions, such as on measures to be taken in the prefecture (Article 8).
In addition, Fuken-kai discussed issues which prefectural governors asked for opinions, such as on measures to be taken in the prefecture (Article 8).

sen.j: これら議案はすべて府知事・県令が発するものとされた（第4条）。
sen.e: All bills were to be submitted by prefectural governors.
All bills were to be submitted by prefectural governors.
All bills were to be submitted by prefectural governors.

sen.j: しかし一方、議員の提案で会議の過半数の賛成をもって、中央政府への建議を行なうこともできた（第7条）。
sen.e: However, councilors were able to propose to the central government, with a agreement from the majority of the session. (Article 7)
However, councilors were able to propose to the central government, with an agreement from the majority of the session (Article 7).
However, councilors were able to propose to the central government, with an agreement from the majority of the session (Article 7).

sen.j: 常置委員設置の改正
sen.e: Establishment of permanent committee
Establishment of permanent committee
Establishment of permanent committee

sen.j: 明治13年（1880年）11月に、府県会規則は改正され、常置委員をおくことが定められた。
sen.e: The Fuken-kai rule was revised in November 1880 and permanent commissioners were set.
The Fuken-kai rules were revised in November 1880 and permanent commissioners were appointed.
The Fuken-kai rules were revised in November 1880 and permanent commissioners were appointed.

sen.j: 名の通り府県会が開かれていない時期にも活動する数人の常置委員が、府知事・県令から地方税支弁事項について諮問を受け、意見を述べるものであった。
sen.e: As the name suggests, several permanent commissioners, who were active even when Fuken-kai was not opened, were consulted and they were to express opinions.
As the name suggests, several permanent commissioners, who were active even when Fuken-kai was not opened, were consulted and they were to express opinions.
As the name suggests, several permanent commissioners, who were active even when Fuken-kai was not opened, were consulted and they were to express opinions.
